intro: Neraudia melastomifolia var. uncinata, commonly known as the hooked neraudia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences and feature five petals, often with a distinctive color contrast between the outer and inner petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
